Reviews.Title: “The best holidyas with my father”
Reviews.Author: Maria M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: *The staff are very frindly and extremely helpful. *The room was really good for the price (but very thin walls). *Very nice breakfast, I consider that it is a good price. *Very close to Camp Nou. *The shampoo is fantastic. Barcelona is amaizing...

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marianarivkin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, 5 minute walk to the train station. Very clean and solid. The staff is very nice. The room was very small, but cozy. There are around coffee shops, and supermarket. Only one metro stop from Plaza Espana.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed In 7 hotels over the last 2 weeks in 3 different countries, and this was by far the worst one.”
Reviews.Author: lmm20
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't find our reservation, but this was ok since I had the confirmation in my email thankfully. The service was terrible. We called for an iron at 6pm and the gentleman at the desk said they didn't have one only housekeeping did and he didn't have the key to their storage. Then the elevator wasn't working when we left around 7 for dinner. We called the front desk again to ask how to dial out to the operator to make a collect call and the same guy says he has no clue. The stay was 'decent', but if you're looking for good customer service, this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service and dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: planotexas1
Reviews.Content: I can't say this is a 3 star hotel as they claim Smelly rooms and very non maintained bathroom Please expect to pay 50euro in cash as deposit The hotel day stuff were very rude Good points : nice breakfast and good location Metro station- sants

Reviews.Title: “essgee”
Reviews.Author: essgee-inde
Reviews.Content: Really bad hotel, The corridoors no widers then 2 and half feet. you can not drag your bag. Corrridoor ceiling broken, doors bang and donot let you sleep. Rooms small and dingy. Lights were not working in 1007 and no one had clue. director refused to meet. Recetionist Joquinm was bad refuses to assit. two girls at reception are good at least speak decntly. i got robbed in Barcelona, No help by hotel i had no money and no passport. To make things worst the wifi on your net does not work and the hotel keeps telling you some problem with your lap top. Our systems are working. Avoid staying at this location. It is better to pay a bit more and stay at little better location. Street gets lonely in the evening. Really bad experience and directo and the gentleman recetionist is bad.

Reviews.Title: “At €64 / night, very good value”
Reviews.Author: gama036
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly & helpful. Room slightly run down, small but quite decent at this price; lovely elaborate bathroom tiles and marble; very thin walls and noisy flooring: neighbors' manners crucial. Quiet despite overlooking a busy crossroads. Lovely place for a brisk walk to Passeig de Gracia as well as quite close to 3 Metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: wenshelado
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is very close to Saints station, that was convenient because we arrived here by train from Valencia and then we left from Saints to the airport. We stayed three nights that gave us just enough time to have a brief visit to Barcelona. The room was just the size and with a third bid for our kid it felt a bit crumpled. The window was in front a residential building, so the view was the kitchens and hanging clothes of the neighbours. When we arrived I noticed that the bathroom lock was not working, so I reported to reception. They promised to fix it but the next night it was still broken, and because it was Saturday they could not fix it, so we stayed with the broken lock for all weekend that was not very convenient. Anyway I asked for a similar room and they found one but we did not have time to move all our stuff given our little time to visit the city. Also the main elevator broke so we had to use the maintenance elevator, that made no difference at all. Anyhow, it shows that this hotel needs some proper maintenance because everything else is fine. The value of the hotel was about thirty percent cheaper compared with other hotels around this location. It was the only hotel available for this price in this location with the short time we booked it, so given this circumstances it was a good selection. Anyway in the future I may take more time to book in advance and possibly find better deals around.

Reviews.Title: “good small hotel close to train station and underground”
Reviews.Author: DriffTigers18
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel rooms were boiling no air con traffic noise outside was loud but thats obvious when u're in a city like barcelona staff were helpful in trying to locate our football tickets for th mallorca match as they offered to ring for us. breakfast was continental, not much of a selection coffee was hot but tea was verdging on cold so had orange hotel was good to stay at and would go again if i return to barca in the future to watch hull city

Reviews.Title: “Dont book here if you like to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: dancer61
Reviews.Content: This is not the place to stay if you like a good nights sleep. Every little sound carries. And every door bangs loudly!! at all times of the night. Very little room for clothes (no draws) and half a dozen coat hangers between us. On the plus side nice staff and luxury size beds. Clean towels every day and room cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: idans
Reviews.Content: The room is clean but small , is good for those who don't stay all day in the hotel. breakfast can satisfy people who concern about kosher . great location , close to Sants train station (Barcelona main train station, about 100m) Monjuic (about 1 km) and downtown (bus near by)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: shamovic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and cheap. The staff is very helpful and nice. Free WiFi access, which is very helpful. It is situated a bit far away from the center, but it is close to the Brcelo Sants station, from which you can take the touristic bus (blue route), the metro, the train and a bus. The place is definitely not dangerous, we walked there at night much and there was nothing intimidating in the surrounding places.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, poor room cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Cherry_Cat_il
Reviews.Content: Close to a metro station (5-6 min. walking) close to pl. Espania (15 min. walking), small rooms but cozy, queit, the breakfast was very nice, the hotel staff- helpfull. Room cleaning- bad, never got fresh towels, ours were folded and put one on the other, we couldn't tell them appart (not very hygienic), the toilet wasn't cleaned during our stay (and there was no brush to do so after using it), strange stains on the sheets... Hm... Even a 3 star hotel can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: osheinkman
Reviews.Content: A very nice and cheap hotel 2 min from central bus/train station best part- a great breakfast and amazing and kind staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not very fancy”
Reviews.Author: amitkuper
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Little rooms but you don't need more than that when you are travelling in Barcelona. All you need is a comfortable bed, large bathroom and a good breakfast, and the hotel provide it all. The hotel is 5 minutes walking from the subway, from which its a 10-15 min riding to the center, So the location is really not bad. I recommend this hotel. However, if you expect a very luxurious hotel, this is not the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Hotel...Do not go here!”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: At first glance, it looks like a common 3 star hotel in Europe. Let me first say the daytime staff are very friendly and helpful. However BEWARE! The man working the night shift has sexually assaulted someone in the hotel during my stay. Do not walk up the stairs alone at night. He speaks english but pretends that he does not when authorities are called. Also during our stay, we had no clean water for 2 days. Brown water would only come out of the faucet. The rooms were very small and not as clean as I have hoped. They have no irons and nearly no amenities. A collegue of mine came in from a hard days work to find her pj's in the bedit. This is terrible! It is a shame the daytime staff is so nice and the breakfast is good, but the danger and unsaftey of the night staff ruins the hotel image.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Motymizrahi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all you need for a sightseeing trip to Barcelona. 5 minutes from the metro that takes you anywhere in few minutes and 15 minutes walking from Pl Espania (you MUST go there in weekends' evenings to see the fountain) The room was comfortable, The bad was large, the brakefast is surprisingly good and the staff was very nice. Our mini-bar wasn't functioning but they let us use their kitchen fridge as much as we wanted. Dont expect great luxury from this Hotel. This is a nice place to go to sleep after a great tiring day in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “good and worth”
Reviews.Author: Ilan_Buchwalter
Reviews.Content: I stay in the hotel for 4 nights and found it very comfortable and charmy.I am limited in movement and it was close to public transportation. The breakfast meal was beyond expectations. The crew were helpful. The room has been arranged twice a day.The bathroom was very modern with a bide, hot water all the time. The hotel was quite in this season in spite it is on the main road. I recommend on it in worm heart.

Reviews.Title: “We do not recomend the Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved Barcelona but can't think of any positive things to say about this hotel. It is not close to any of the city's tourist attractions, certainly not La Rambla. It's rated 3 stars, but is worthy of 2 at best. It has no charm or curb appeal -- if you aren't paying attention you will walk/drive right past it since it is no wider than 10 meters across the front and wedged between two other nondescript gray buildings. If you are driving a car beware, the garage is in a separate building, getting in and out is difficult due to tight corners and ramps, and all the hotel information (website, brochures, etc.) conveniently leave out the fact that parking will cost you 15 euro / day. Rooms face either a depressing concrete shaft in the middle of the building or a very noisy street on the front side. Even after long days of walking this beautiful city the unbearable street noise made it difficult to sleep. When it comes to hotel choices in Barcelona, you can do much better for the same cost. Even if proximity to the Estacio Sants station is a priority, there are better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the roma for four nights this year in august. Our room was lovely, tastefully decorated and clean. The staff were all very attentive and helpful makin us feel welcome although at 18 we were probably the youngest people there. The hotel is very well situated, around 5mins from metro, tourist bus and taxi points all of which are very easy to find, but it still remains peaceful at night. All in all it made my first time in barcelona very enjoyable and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Very Helpful Staff..!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10th-14th June 2004 and can highly recommend it. Ideally place for the the metro & station & a short walk from some very nice restaurants, a lovely bakery, nice bar next door - very nice sangria..! We had a tastefully furnished room on the 6th floor (lovely & quiet), bathroom was fine, clean etc - everything you'd expect. Your every whim catered for - well stocked mini-bar, fresh towels everyday, the usual toiletries - even a comb & a shoe-polisher! There's a mini-safe too (small charge, 3 euros per day), on the whole a great place to stay. We were there for the Catalunya Moto GP, we'll be there next year too..!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the Roma. I was due to stay at the Roma but on arriving was informed that their was a fault with the Hotel (I understand something to do with heating) - accomadation had been aranged, with an upgrade in another of the chains Hotels in the City and the taxi (at their cost) would be at the door to pick us up in two minutes. The customer service and way they handled a problem was first rate and I was extreamly pleased with my treatment. The Hotel we went to was good, clean and plesent and on this basis I would recomend this Hotel Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" takes the biscuit. Although it's a fair old distance to La Rambla, the public transport is excellent and will have you there in under 10 minutes. The hotel is a different matter. Read on if you dare...Our check in time was supposed to be 11.50am but our room was not available until almost 1.00pm. As you can appreciate, having been up since 4.30am, we were eager to rest. Not the worst start you say, well here goes. Our room, 1006, was located on floor E (between the lobby and the first floor if you can picture it) with a single-glazed window "overlooking" the entrance lobby doors. Essentially, this meant that we had virtually no natural light and no privacy, as the window was not suited to sound deadening purposes. We had to keep the drapes and blackout curtain closed for the entire weekend. Combine that with the paper-thin walls (where I could hear the Italian woman next door, "pronto, pronto, pronto") and the picture is starting to fill out!There were cracks and water stains on the ceiling of the room. Mould was beginning to bubble and grow behind the main entrance door to the room. The air conditioning unit expelled hot air (regardless of whether the hot or cold setting was selected), thus making the room extremely uncomfortable to sleep and rest in. Hot water for showers etc. was scarce after 9.30am (evidently, it was syphoned off to the heating system). The most interesting point about the room was having what sounded like the main sewage pipe for the entire building running down the side of our bed. Every time somebody flushed a toilet it sounded as if the biblical flood of Moses was about to inundate us! So disconcerting was the noise that we had two very restless nights. That was not the extent of our suffering in Hotel Roma.On our very first night, at 1.15am, we had two intruders in the room. I heard the door to our room unlocking and I sprang from the bed just as two men entered the room. Fortunately, a loud roar persuaded them to leave rather quickly. When we tried to report this to the front desk the next morning, I had barely gotten the words 'bon dia' out of my mouth when the receptionist was apologising for the incident, which a 'guest' had already reported. Apparently the guest was drunk, had mistaken his first floor with our 'E' floor and stumbled into our room. The 'guest' maintained that the door to the room was open and he simply pushed it open and walked in. The receptionist told us that the two floors were the same in layout and that we must have forgotten to lock our door. This is not the case with any of the above.Unfortunately, I have a terrible habit with locks; I can't even drive to the shops without making sure that every door in the car is locked. This is how I know that I locked the door. I know that my partner checked it after me, as she has the same inclination. Consequently, I know that the door could not have simply been pushed open. Secondly, the two men were not drunk. They didn't stare at me when I shouted at them, as drunkards would do. Both were fully cognisant of their surrounding and left without even tripping over one another. What was most disturbing was that the second man had a key in the door and it was not the card that guests use to enter their rooms. It is this which makes me believe that it was a staff member trying to do God only knows what. Finally, I went up to the first floor to see the layout for myself after leaving the receptionist. Although the general L-shape of the building was the same on that floor, the arrangement of the doors was completely different. In my opinion, there is no way that there could be any confusion between the floors, and hence the rooms.Immediately after the 1.15am incident, somebody in the lobby started moving the furniture around the marble floor, creating a horrible screeching sound. Who, other than staff members, would be able to do this at this hour? I felt like calling ghostbusters! This cacophony continued for about two hours; I know this because it kept me awake, watching "satellite TV", which consisted of French, Spanish, Italian and one BBC news station. In total, there were 8 wonderfully entertaining foreign stations. I ended up having a makeshift barrier behind our locked door, "MacGyvered" from two suitcases and a chair. All I was short of was the double barrell and the rocking chair. The rest of the weekend in that hotel was (thankfully) relatively uneventful.Hotel Catalonia Roma was not my idea of a nice hotel by any means. I have nothing but compassion for the poor misfortunates who stay in this hotel.I have stayed at many hotels throughout Ireland and Europe, mainly budget, and this is the first time I have experienced anything like this. Needless to say, I cannot recommend the Hotel Catalonia Roma on any level. Upon investigation throughout the city itself, we found that we would have had far superior accommodation in a better location.Stay clear of this particular hotel. If there's anybody familiar with Fawlty Towers and Basil Fawlty out there, then you'll appreciate that you should avoid this place as if it were like the in-laws house.Truely dreadful.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida de Roma 31, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
